      • sortMap

        public static <K,V extends java.lang.Comparable<? super V>> java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<K,V>> sortMap(java.util.Map<K,V> data,
                                                                                             boolean inverse)
        sort an Map<K, V extends Comparable<? extends V> map object

        Remark: note that this method may be memory-consuming as it needs to make an ArrayList copy of input Map data. Instead, we suggest to store original data in List<Map.Entry<K,V>> and use sortList() method to avoid object copying.

        Type Parameters:
        K - type parameter
        V - type parameter
        Parameters:
        data - map data
        inverse - descending if true; otherwise ascending
        Returns:
        a sorted list

      • sortListTopK

        public static <K,V extends java.lang.Comparable<? super V>> java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<K,V>> sortListTopK(java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<K,V>> data,
                                                                                                  boolean inverse,
                                                                                                  int k)
        sort a list of objects: List<Map.Entry<K, V extends Comparable<? extends V>>
        Type Parameters:
        K - type parameter
        V - type parameter
        Parameters:
        data - map data
        inverse - descending if true; otherwise ascending
        k - k
        Returns:
        a topk sorted list 10000 users, 10000 items, top 30, 809ms vs 18654ms 10000 users, 10000 items, top 100, 1443ms vs 18654ms 10000 users, 100000 items, top 30, 10.4s vs 323s 10000 users, 100000 items, top 100, 10.8s vs 323s
